thread.title: Arsenal FC transfer news: Petr Cech will not leave Emirates this summer, claims agent | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal FC transfer news: Petr Cech will not leave Emirates this summer, claims agent | Metro News

author: Louis Sealey For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal FC transfer news: Petr Cech will not leave Emirates this summer, claims agent | Metro News
text:
Louis Sealey for Metro.co.uk Sunday 12 Feb 2017 6:07 pm Arsenal goalkeeper Petr Cech will not leave at the end of the season (Picture: Getty) 
Petr Cech will not be leaving Arsenal this summer, according to his agent. 
The 34-year-old has been one of the Premier League’s stand-out goalkeeper since signing for Chelsea from Rennes in 2004. Mesut Ozil suffering CRISIS of confidence, admits Arsenal boss Wenger 
However, there have been question marks over his future in north London after he committed a number of high-profile errors for under-performing Arsenal. 
The latest came during Arsenal’s dismal 3-1 defeat to London rivals Chelsea – Cech gifted Cesc Fabregas and his former club a simple third goal at Stamford Bridge. 
Speculation over his future at the Emirates intensified after the Gunners were linked with a number of goalkeepers, including England star Joe Hart and Sunderland’s Jordan Pickford. 
However, Cech’s agent insists his client will remain at Arsenal until 2019, when his current contract expires. Arsenal fixtures 
Bayern Munich – Champions League (A) – Wed 15 Feb Sutton – FA Cup (A) – weekend of 17/18 Feb Liverpool (A) – Sat 4 Mar Bayern Munich – Champions League (H) – Tue 7 Mar Leicester (H) – Sat 11 Mar West Brom (A) – Sat 18 Mar Manchester City (H) – Sat 1 Apr West Ham (H) – Tue 4 Apr The experienced stopper has not found his best form in recent weeks (Picture: Getty) Arsene Wenger has backed his goalkeeper despite his levels dropping (Picture: Getty) 
‘Petr’s position at the club is very secure and a summer transfer can be ruled out,’ agent Viktor Kolar said in a statement.
